Author: Cryptonian#5022
Content: Can you stake KMD in the Agama wallet, or can it only be done in QT?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
KMD is not staked. You don't need to run a wallet to accumulate the rewards. 
Claiming is working in Agama native / lite mode, and any other wallet not just in Qt.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
ok, my suggestion is to backup your wallet.dat files
then delete the blockchain data and either sync from scratch or use a bootstrap

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: and make sure you are using the latest ocean qt wallet

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: can you confirm it was this one? https://github.com/DeckerSU/KomodoOcean/releases/tag/v3.0.0-beta1-9979ca2

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: using multiple versions of different wallets for native mode has a high chance of corrupting your local data

Author: userpike#6501
Content: I will DL that version of Ocean and see what happens. but i really like the Verus-Agama

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
the verus agama is very good for lite mode but, I find the ocean wallet works well for native mode

even if you prefer the agama wallet for native mode, delete the blockchain data and use the latest agama version to sync

Author: userpike#6501
Content: ok I'll give it a try. thanks for the assistance

Author: gregmcgolf#5997
Content: Noobie here from THC. Can someone please point me in the right direction for instructions on how to update the komodo binaries? I went to Github and saw the komodo 0.5.0 obsidon dragon file, downloaded it, but have no clue what to do from there. I have komodo on a Linux machine, and I also have a windows 7 machine. I don't use the komodo, but needed to start it so I could then run THC on an associated chain, and it all  works fine, but now I am told I have to upgrade komodo before the THC fork Dec 20. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated, thx.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Just:
1) replace current komodod binary you have with binary from 0.5.0 release archive
restart THC chain:
2) stop THC chain (`./komodo-cli -ac_name=THC stop`)
3) start THC chain with new binary 
`./komodod -ac_name=THC -ac_supply=251253103 -ac_reward=360000000,300000000,240000000,180000000,150000000,90000000,0 -ac_staked=100 -ac_eras=7 -ac_end=500001,1000001,1500001,2000001,2500001,4500001,0 -ac_perc=233333333 -ac_cc=2 -ac_ccenable=229,236,240 -ac_script=2ea22c8020987fad30df055db6fd922c3a57e55d76601229ed3da3b31340112e773df3d0d28103120c008203000401ccb8 -ac_founders=150 -ac_cbmaturity=1 -ac_sapling=1 -addnode=157.230.45.184 -addnode=165.22.52.123 -earlytxid=7e4a76259e99c9379551389e9f757fc5f46c33ae922a8644dc2b187af2a6adc1 &`

Author: gregmcgolf#5997
Content: You da man, thx Will give it a go

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Glad to help üëç  Note that on Windows machine you'll need to orient slashes different (`.\komodo-cli` and `.\komodod`)

Author: gregmcgolf#5997
Content: Great, good point

Author: gregmcgolf#5997
Content: Ok, this may sound basic, but can't figure out how to replace "komodod binary" and don't know what that file(s) is/are or where to put them? I thought I did it correctly, renamed the komodo folder to komodo old, then put all the new extracted files in a new komodo folder, restarted the daemon and it seeemed to work, but then when I run getinfo, it says the kmd version is 0.4.0a so obviously it is still using the old data

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Are you sure that starting the daemon from not old folder? Do you see `0.4.0a` after update on both Linux and Windows?
